defs.docs: A generic connection pool.

attributes.value: / A generic connection pool.
/ Opening a new database connection every time one is needed is both
/ inefficient and can lead to resource exhaustion under high traffic
/ conditions. A connection pool maintains a set of open connections to a
/ database, handing them out for repeated use.
/ r2d2 is agnostic to the connection type it is managing. Implementors of the
/ `ManageConnection` trait provide the database-specific logic to create and
/ check the health of connections.
/ # Example
/ Using an imaginary "foodb" database.
/ ```rust,ignore
/ use std::thread;
/ extern crate r2d2;
/ extern crate r2d2_foodb;
/ fn main() {
/     let manager = r2d2_foodb::FooConnectionManager::new("localhost:1234");
/     let pool = r2d2::Pool::builder()
/         .max_size(15)
/         .build(manager)
/         .unwrap();
/         let pool = pool.clone();
/         thread::spawn(move || {
/             let conn = pool.get().unwrap();
/             // use the connection
/             // it will be returned to the pool when it falls out of scope.
warn(missing_docs)

defs.name: Builder
defs.docs: A builder for a connection pool.

attributes.value: / A builder for a connection pool.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Constructs a new `Builder`.

attributes.value: / Constructs a new `Builder`.
/ Parameters are initialized with their default values.

defs.name: max_size
defs.docs: Sets the maximum number of connections managed by the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the maximum number of connections managed by the pool.
/ Defaults to 10.
/ # Panics
/ Panics if `max_size` is 0.

defs.name: min_idle
defs.docs: Sets the minimum idle connection count maintained by the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the minimum idle connection count maintained by the pool.
/ If set, the pool will try to maintain at least this many idle
/ connections at all times, while respecting the value of `max_size`.
/ Defaults to `None` (equivalent to the value of `max_size`).

defs.name: thread_pool
defs.docs:
Sets the thread pool used for asynchronous operations such as connection
 creation.

attributes.value: / Sets the thread pool used for asynchronous operations such as connection
/ creation.
/ Defaults to a new pool with 3 threads.

defs.name: test_on_check_out
defs.docs:
If true, the health of a connection will be verified via a call to
 `ConnectionManager::is_valid` before it is checked out of the pool.

attributes.value: / If true, the health of a connection will be verified via a call to
/ `ConnectionManager::is_valid` before it is checked out of the pool.
/ Defaults to true.

defs.name: max_lifetime
defs.docs: Sets the maximum lifetime of connections in the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the maximum lifetime of connections in the pool.
/ If set, connections will be closed after existing for at most 30 seconds
/ beyond this duration.
/ If a connection reaches its maximum lifetime while checked out it will
/ be closed when it is returned to the pool.
/ Defaults to 30 minutes.
/ # Panics
/ Panics if `max_lifetime` is the zero `Duration`.

defs.name: idle_timeout
defs.docs: Sets the idle timeout used by the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the idle timeout used by the pool.
/ If set, connections will be closed after sitting idle for at most 30
/ seconds beyond this duration.
/ Defaults to 10 minutes.
/ # Panics
/ Panics if `idle_timeout` is the zero `Duration`.

defs.name: connection_timeout
defs.docs: Sets the connection timeout used by the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the connection timeout used by the pool.
/ Calls to `Pool::get` will wait this long for a connection to become
/ available before returning an error.
/ Defaults to 30 seconds.
/ # Panics
/ Panics if `connection_timeout` is the zero duration

defs.name: error_handler
defs.docs: Sets the handler for errors reported in the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the handler for errors reported in the pool.
/ Defaults to the `LoggingErrorHandler`.

defs.name: event_handler
defs.docs: Sets the handler for events reported by the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the handler for events reported by the pool.
/ Defaults to the `NopEventHandler`.

defs.name: connection_customizer
defs.value:
pub fn connection_customizer(Self,
                             Box<CustomizeConnection<M::Connection,
                                                     M::Error>>) -> Builder<M>
defs.docs: Sets the connection customizer used by the pool.

attributes.value: / Sets the connection customizer used by the pool.
/ Defaults to the `NopConnectionCustomizer`.

defs.name: build
defs.value: pub fn build(Self, M) -> Result<Pool<M>, Error>
defs.docs: Consumes the builder, returning a new, initialized pool.

attributes.value: / Consumes the builder, returning a new, initialized pool.
/ It will block until the pool has established its configured minimum
/ number of connections, or it times out.
/ # Errors
/ Returns an error if the pool is unable to open its minimum number of
/ connections.
/ # Panics
/ Panics if `min_idle` is greater than `max_size`.

defs.name: build_unchecked
defs.docs: Consumes the builder, returning a new pool.

attributes.value: / Consumes the builder, returning a new pool.
/ Unlike `build`, this method does not wait for any connections to be
/ established before returning.
/ # Panics
/ Panics if `min_idle` is greater than `max_size`.

defs.name: Extensions
defs.docs: A "type map" used to associate data with pooled connections.

attributes.value: / A "type map" used to associate data with pooled connections.
/ `Extensions` is a data structure mapping types to a value of that type. This
/ can be used to, for example, cache prepared statements along side their
/ connection.

defs.name: is_valid
defs.value: pub fn is_valid(&Self, &mut Self::Connection) -> Result<(), Self::Error>
defs.docs: Determines if the connection is still connected to the database.

attributes.value: / Determines if the connection is still connected to the database.
/ A standard implementation would check if a simple query like `SELECT 1`
/ succeeds.

defs.name: has_broken
defs.docs: *Quickly* determines if the connection is no longer usable.

attributes.value: / *Quickly* determines if the connection is no longer usable.
/ This will be called synchronously every time a connection is returned
/ to the pool, so it should *not* block. If it returns `true`, the
/ connection will be discarded.
/ For example, an implementation might check if the underlying TCP socket
/ has disconnected. Implementations that do not support this kind of
/ fast health check may simply return `false`.

defs.name: HandleError
defs.docs: A trait which handles errors reported by the `ManageConnection`.

attributes.value: / A trait which handles errors reported by the `ManageConnection`.

attributes.value: / Handles an error.

attributes.value: / A `HandleError` implementation which does nothing.

defs.name: LoggingErrorHandler
defs.docs: A `HandleError` implementation which logs at the error level.

attributes.value: / A `HandleError` implementation which logs at the error level.

defs.docs:
Called with connections immediately after they are returned from
 `ManageConnection::connect`.

attributes.value: / Called with connections immediately after they are returned from
/ `ManageConnection::connect`.
/ The default implementation simply returns `Ok(())`.
/ # Errors
/ If this method returns an error, the connection will be discarded.
allow(unused_variables)

defs.name: on_release
defs.docs: Called with connections when they are removed from the pool.

attributes.value: / Called with connections when they are removed from the pool.
/ The connections may be broken (as reported by `is_valid` or
/ `has_broken`), or have simply timed out.
/ The default implementation does nothing.
allow(unused_variables)

defs.name: get_timeout

defs.docs: Retrieves a connection from the pool, waiting for at most `timeout`

attributes.value: / Retrieves a connection from the pool, waiting for at most `timeout`
/ The given timeout will be used instead of the configured connection
/ timeout.

defs.name: try_get
defs.docs:
Attempts to retrieve a connection from the pool if there is one
 available.

attributes.value: / Attempts to retrieve a connection from the pool if there is one
/ available.
/ Returns `None` if there are no idle connections available in the pool.
/ This method will not block waiting to establish a new connection.
